intro: Ludwigia micrantha, commonly known as the dwarf Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant in aquatic and semi-aquatic setups due to its ornamental value. Ludwigia micrantha is also noted for its ability to purify water and provide habitat for small aquatic organisms.
